issue.title: Attitude to overloaded comma for iterators

blockquote.p: Unless otherwise specified, global and non-member functions in the standard library shall not use functions from another namespace which are found through argument-dependent name lookup (3.4.2).

discussion.p: This sounds clear enough. There are just two problems:

li.p: Both implementations I tested (VS2005 and GCC 3.4.3) do unqualified calls to the comma operator in some parts of the library with operands of user-defined types.
The standard itself does this in the description of some algorithms. E.g. uninitialized_copy is defined as:

discussion.p:
If understood literally, it is required to call operator,(ForwardIterator, InputIterator).
For detailed discussion with code samples see here.
Proposal:

ol.li: Add an exception to the rule in by permitting the implementation to call the comma operator as much as it wants to. I doubt we want this. or
Fix the description of the said algorithms and perhaps add a note to that brings attention of the implementers to avoid this pitfall.
